DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to refine and test the web-based delivery of a well-established in-person group program that provides information and education to informal caregivers (family and friends) of persons with Alzheimer's disease (or related illnesses).
DOC.brief_title: Distance Savvy: Testing Tele-Savvy, a Distance Dementia Family Caregiver Education Program
DOC.detailed_description: The pilot project proposed will allow the investigators to use telehealth methods to deliver the Savvy Caregiver, an evidence-based dementia caregiver psychoeducation program, to family caregivers of community-dwelling persons with dementing illnesses (PWD) for whom attending in-person meetings poses difficulties. The program - named Tele-Savvy - uses iPad and PC technology and on-line conferencing capacity to deliver the program through daily asynchronous self-learning modules and weekly, hour-long synchronous group meetings with program facilitators. Tele-Savvy addresses all of the learning objectives of the current in-person Savvy program (Savvy entails in-person participation in six weekly two-hour group sessions).
DOC.criteria: an informal caregiver for a person with a dementing disorder, such as Alzheimer's disease able to speak, read, and understand English has access to a computer with internet connection lives in the US unwilling to participate in data gathering
